DOC.brief_summary: Design : Single-centre Indication : Malaria cause Plasmodium falciparum Objectives : To determine compare efficacy AQ treatment young child uncomplicated falciparum malaria rural urban study area Centre de Recherche en Santé de Nouna ( CRSN ) . Population : Children age 6-59 month uncomplicated falciparum malaria ( axillary temperature ≥ 37.5°C + ≥ 2.000 P. falciparum asexual parasite per µl blood ) health centre situate village Bagala , Bourasso Kemena Nouna town hospital outpatient department . Sample size : N=120 Treatment : All child receive total dose 25 mg/kg oral AQ period three day ( first second day : 10mg/kg , third day : 5mg/kg ) . Statistical procedure : The primary analysis parameter proportion clinical failure day 14 . Secondary parameter rate clinical failure day 28 ( without PCR correction ) , rate early clinical failure , rate late parasitological failure ( day 14 day 28 ) , rate adverse event . Data analyse overall group study child rural ( n=50 ) urban ( n=50 ) study child separately . Study duration date : The study implement September-December 2005 .
DOC.brief_title: Efficacy Amodiaquine Treatment Uncomplicated Falciparum Malaria Young Children Burkina Faso
DOC.criteria: Age 659 month Uncomplicated falciparum malaria ( axillary temperature ≥ 37.5°C ≥ 2.000 P. falciparum asexual parasite per µl blood ) Written informed consent give parents/caretakers Complicated severe malaria ( repeat vomiting , seizures neurological impairment , haemoglobin < 7 g/dl haematocrit < 21 % ) Any apparent significant disease ( e. g. pneumonia , meningitis , hepatitis , severe diarrhoea , measles , severe malnutrition ) Malaria treatment western drug and/or antibiotic anti malarial potency last 7 day except chloroquine .
